title: Did the clocks go back last night and when do they go forward in 2020?
text:
The clocks go back this weekend. (Picture: Moose Photos)

If you’ve woken up in a state of confusion today wondering what time it is and if the clocks went back last night, don’t worry, you’re not alone.

It may happen twice every year in the UK, but the bi-annual changing of the clocks to go either backwards or forwards for Daylight Savings seems to throw us every time.

This is when the clocks went back last night and when you can expect them to go forwards again – so you can mark it in your diary in advance for 2020.

Did the clocks go back last night?

Yup, the clocks did indeed go back very early this morning on Sunday 27 October 2019.

The time changed at 2am Greenwich Mean Time overnight meaning that at 2am it became 1am GMT instead.

This might mean that you got to enjoy an extra hour of sleep this morning – maybe without even realising it.

Nothing better than an extra hour of sleep on a Sunday. (Picture: Acharaporn Kamornboonyarush)

Most mobile devices will adjust the time automatically (like smartphones often do for time zone changes) for daylight saving time, so your phone should already show the correct time.

You will however need to change analogue and car clocks so show the new, earlier time.

When do the clocks go forward again in 2020?

Now that the clocks have gone back for the winter, we won’t see them change again until spring next year.

The clocks will go forward one hour on Sunday March 29 2020, when Daylight Savings starts again and the countdown to British Summer Time begins.
